s.text: But British papers were dominated by the rain that wiped out all play Tuesday at the Wimbledon tennis championships and by an administrative fiasco at the government Passport Agency, which has left more than half a million people due to travel abroad within the next four weeks waiting for passports.
It said: "Formally commuting the death sentence might, for now, strike Turkish voters as weak.

In Italy, the papers also led on European warnings to Turkey not to carry out the death sentence, and La Repubblica of Rome said that just as the price for Russia's cooperation in Kosovo had been a huge loan, so perhaps the price of Ocalan's life would be Turkey's entry into Europe.
